content.description:
Make one thin slab move (crux) and then sidle up the steepening crack to a thrilling finish high above the pads.

Downclimb by heading to the left and then down a slab with some knobs which will get you onto the shelf above Driblet, where a quick hand traverse and final easy corner will get you to the ground (see photo).
content.location: The prominent left-slanting crack/rail right of the Dripper Problems just right of center on the West Face.

content.description:
Start up a slanting rail to it's apex and then reach high for the start of left-slanting flake which culminates with an exciting mantel over a bulge. Finish up easy face to the top.

Downclimb by heading to the left and then down a slab with some knobs which will get you onto the shelf above Driblet, where a quick hand traverse and final easy corner will get you to the ground (see photo).
content.location: Right of center on the West Face.

content.description: This testy little problem is classic Josh and requires the usual comination of footwork and balance as you lieback up a shallow corner system just left of an arete. Downclimb by hand traversing the top and then down an easy corner to the left.

Start at a right-slanting flake and then stem and contort your way up and left until able to reach into the bottom of a widening flake. The crux is controlling the swing as you commit to the flake but shorter climbers may disagree with that. Once established in the flake make a few airy moves and mantle over on jugs. A short bit of easy but exposed face leads to the top. Quality.

Downclimb by heading to the left and then down a slab with some knobs which will get you onto the shelf above Driblet, where a quick hand traverse and final easy corner will get you to the ground (see photo).
